items.title: Story of our logo
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>These trees have stood tall for centuries.

The Lodgepole Pine and Mount Kidd are more than just Canadian natural landmarks – they represent the #G7’s resilience and hold special significance to local Treaty 7 Nations.

#G7Canada #G7Kananaskis2025 #Treaty7</article>

items.title: Canada’s Impact in Papua New Guinea
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>As Canada and Papua New Guinea celebrate 50 years of diplomatic relations, we’re looking back to a proud moment of partnership. See how one Canadian physiotherapist sparked lasting change in Papua New Guinea’s physiotherapy landscape 35 years ago.</article>

items.title: Global Affairs Canada: We are Canada in the world. 🇨🇦🤝🌎
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Global Affairs Canada works every day to shape a more peaceful, prosperous, and sustainable world for Canadians 
  
We deliver by: 
🆘 Providing trusted support to Canadians abroad 
📈 Opening doors for Canadian businesses 
🕊️ Promoting peace, democracy, and human rights 
🌱 Driving climate action and inclusive development 
  
Because what happens globally shapes life here at home. 
 
We are Canada in the world. 🇨🇦🤝🌎</article>

items.title: Global Affairs Canada: We are Canada in the world. 🇨🇦🤝🌎
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>Global Affairs Canada works every day to shape a more peaceful, prosperous, and sustainable world for Canadians. 🍁</article>

items.title: G7s In Canada
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Canada hosted the #G7 Summit for the 7th time this year. From Montebello in 1981 to Charlevoix in 2018, Canada has welcomed world leaders as they worked to take action on global issues.

Watch this video to learn about key moments from our six previous G7 presidencies!

#G7Kananaskis #G7Canada</article>

items.title: Be Storm Ready When You Travel
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>🌴☀️ Travelling to a sunny destination? Tropical storms can happen—be prepared. Check our advice to be informed before you go abroad during #HurricaneSeason: https://travel.gc.ca/travelling/health-safety/hurricanes-typhoons-cyclones-monsoons</article>

items.title: Regional Connectivity Envelope – Information Session EN
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>This is a recording of the information session on the Regional Connectivity Envelope hosted by Global Affairs Canada.</article>

items.title: Global Affairs Canada’s 2025 State of Trade report
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Global Affairs Canada’s 2025 State of Trade report is out. 
 
It shows that Canada’s trade hit new milestones despite global uncertainty. 
 
In 2024, Canadian exports grew by 1.9%, reaching $997 billion. 
 
Flow of Foreign direct investment (FDI) into Canada surged by 36.2% to $85.5 billion—the second-highest level in history. 
 
The report is clear: Canada remains a top destination for global business. 
 
Canada’s trade: reliable, bold, and global. 

Read the full report: https://international.canada.ca/en/global-affairs/corporate/transparency/reports-publications/chief-economist/state-trade/2025</article>

items.title: G7 Leaders' Summit 2025: Closing Remarks
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Closing remarks of the G7 Leaders’ Summit delivered by the Right Honourable Mark Carney, Prime Minister of Canada, on June 17, 2025.
 
Canada hosted G7 leaders and partners for two days of open talks that led to agreements on priorities such as critical minerals, quantum tech, AI adoption, wildfires, and transnational crime.
  
#G7Kananaskis2025   #G7Canada</article>

items.title: G7 Leaders' Summit 2025: Opening Remarks
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Opening remarks of the G7 Leaders’ Summit delivered by the Right Honourable Mark Carney, Prime Minister of Canada, on June 16, 2025.
 
The eyes of the world were upon the #G7 Summit as partner nations tackled issues such as international peace and security, economic prosperity, critical minerals, energy security, artificial intelligence and more.

#g7kananaskis2025  #g7canada</article>

items.title: One-year anniversary of the modernized Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>This year we mark the one-year anniversary of the modernized Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement!     

Despite Russia’s ongoing illegal and unjustified war of aggression, the Canada-Ukraine partnership continues

The modernized Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA):  
✅ supports long-term security, stability and economic recovery in #Ukraine 
✅ ️provides improved market access for Canadian exporters 
✅ provides a strong foundation for trade and investment  

A win-win for everyone. 
 
For more info: https://www.international.gc.ca/trade-commerce/trade-agreements-accords-commerciaux/agr-acc/ukraine/about-a_propos.aspx?lang=eng</article>

items.title: Registration of Canadians Abroad
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Planning a trip outside Canada? Register with us for direct notifications about your destination, such as: 
🚨, Picture important information in case of a natural disaster or civil unrest 
🚨, Picture instructions to follow during an emergency 
🚨, Picture travel advice updates that could affect your safety 

You can register multiple destinations and co-travellers. Find out more: https://ow.ly/57S650RblZ6</article>

items.title: Travelling with medication
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>One of our consular officers has some important information to share! 
If you are travelling outside of Canada with medication: 
-ensure it is legal in the country you are visiting 
-keep it in its original labelled container 
-bring a copy of the original prescription 

For more useful information: 
https://ow.ly/CY8G50TPLKU</article>

items.title: Support for Canadians Facing a Death Overseas
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>How can the government help if a loved one dies while outside of Canada? Listen to some important information from a consular official. 

Officials can: 
- provide advice on how to get in touch with the appropriate authorities 
- authenticate the local death certificate for insurance or repatriation purposes 

Officials can’t: 
- pay for the repatriation of remains 
- provide legal advice 

For more information: https://ow.ly/3Vpj50UsCc0</article>

items.title: Travel Checklist For Canadians Going Abroad
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>Whether you're dreaming of sandy beaches, bustling cities, or serene countryside, don’t forget to read up on your destination on travel.gc.ca and register with us before you go! https://ow.ly/Hazu50V66pF</article>
